title: Ticket #4806: condor_q should support "-limit" to control the number of results
description:
When debugging a schedd, I often want to look at a single job out of a problematic task. Hence, I do something along the lines of: 

condor_q -const BLAH | head

to get a job ID, then 

condor_q 12345.6 -l | sort

to get the attributes I'm interested in.

In some cases, BLAH may match a few 10k worth of jobs - and I throw out everything but the first. Then, I have to do a second query (meaning a second fork on busy schedds, etc). It'd be more convenient (and more efficient use of resources) if I could combine this into a single query: 

condor_q -const BLAH -l -limit 1 | sort

Note that condor_history uses -match for this, it should be changed to also take -limit as a synonym.
